meanings.definition: To surpass in hustle or energy.
meanings.sent1: She managed to outhustle her opponents in the race.
meanings.sent2: He always tries to outhustle his coworkers to finish tasks quickly.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel decided to outhustle the other animals to gather the most nuts.
meanings.sent4: The young entrepreneur was determined to outhustle the competition and succeed in business.
meanings.sent5: The cheetah's speed allowed it to outhustle the other animals in the savanna.

meanings.definition: To outdo in a competitive situation.
meanings.sent1: In the game, she was able to outhustle her opponent and win.
meanings.sent2: The team worked hard to outhustle their rivals and secure the championship.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox tried to outhustle the other animals in the forest to get the most food.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outhustle his competitors led him to achieve great success.
meanings.sent5: The ambitious student aimed to outhustle his classmates and excel in academics.
